definition: audience/spectators/onlookers
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
customer/visitor/guest

sentences.english: Foreigner remained, in the purest sense, spectators, on the outside looking in.
sentences.chinese: 外国人还是最单纯意义上的看客，只能在外围远观。

sentences.english: at that point, he, too, would be merely a spectator to history.
sentences.chinese: 到那时，他也只能沦为历史的看客。

sentences.english: As they watch the ladies, they scribble on paper.
sentences.chinese: 在看客的观赏间，美丽的女士跃然纸上。

sentences.english: The more intelligent spectators conclude that most people naturally float.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的看客认为大多数人都能自然而然地浮起来。

sentences.english: You're a solitary gazer , a thinker.
sentences.chinese: 你是孤独的看客，是智者。

definition: peanut gallery (esp. in online forums)/onlookers who are interested in the spectacle but don't have anything knowledgeable to say about it/(neologism c. 2016)
keyboard warrior
sth that people like to chat about/topic of idle conversation
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
dear reader/dear listener
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
leisure time (over a cup of tea, after a meal etc)
spectators/audience/visitors (to an exhibition etc)
leading role/lead
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
loser
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
fan/fanatic
sprayer/spraying apparatus/(slang) firearm/Internet troll/hater
